hu.kazocsaba.math.geometry

Class Line3

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.kazocsaba.math.geometry.Line
      • hu.kazocsaba.math.geometry.Line3

  • public class Line3
extends Line
    A line in 3D space. It is specified by a point P and a direction D through the formula P + t*D where the t parameter is used to specify the points of the line. D is not necessarily unit length.
    Author:
    Kaz√≥ Csaba

    • Method Detail

      • getDir

        public ImmutableVector3 getDir()
        Description copied from class: Line
        Returns the direction D of the line. The length of the direction vector is not necessarily one.
        Overrides:
        getDir in class Line
        Returns:
        D

      • getUnitDir

        public ImmutableVector3 getUnitDir()
        Description copied from class: Line
        Returns the unit vector specifying the direction of the line. The returned vector is identical to
        getDir().normalized().
        Overrides:
        getUnitDir in class Line
        Returns:
        the direction of the line as a unit vector

      • getPoint

        public ImmutableVector3 getPoint()
        Description copied from class: Line
        Returns the point P specifying the line.
        Overrides:
        getPoint in class Line
        Returns:
        P

      • getPointAt

        public Vector3 getPointAt(double t)
        Description copied from class: Line
        Returns the point on this line corresponding to the parameter value. The parameter t is linear, its value is 0 at point and 1 at point+dir.
        Overrides:
        getPointAt in class Line
        Parameters:
        t - the parameter value
        Returns:
        P + t*D

      • getPointWhereCoord

        public Vector3 getPointWhereCoord(int coord,
                         double value)
        Description copied from class: Line
        Returns the point of the line for which the specified coordinate has a given value.
        Overrides:
        getPointWhereCoord in class Line
        Parameters:
        coord - the index of the coordinate
        value - the value of the coordinate
        Returns:
        the requested point of this line

      • createFromDir

        public static Line3 createFromDir(Vector3 point,
                  Vector3 dir)
        Creates a new line from a point and a direction.
        Parameters:
        point - a point on the line
        dir - the direction of the line
        Returns:
        the new line
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length of the direction vector is too small

      • createFromTwoPoints

        public static Line3 createFromTwoPoints(Vector3 p1,
                        Vector3 p2)
        Creates a new line which passes through two points. The direction vector of the line will be p2-p1. This means that p1 will be the point for parameter value t = 0, and p2 will be at t = 1.
        Parameters:
        p1 - the first point
        p2 - the second point
        Returns:
        the new line
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the distance between the points is too small

      • getRotation

        public Matrix3 getRotation(double angle)
        Returns the matrix which rotates around the direction of this line with the specified angle. See this Wikipedia link.

        For example, if getDir()=(0,0,1) and R=getRotation(Math.PI/2), then R*(1,1,0)=(-1,1,0).

        Parameters:
        angle - the angle in radians
        Returns:
        the rotation matrix
